result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Defendant may have non-abusive contact with Erica Hernandez for the purposes of discussing and arranging child related issues including, but not limited to, visitation, provided that such contact be in written form which may include physical mail, e-mail, instant messaging, and other electronic and non-electronic forms of communication generating a written or graphic record of the communication.    
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group

records.addlTxt: DNA Submission Form

11:00 am - DA calls cases 16CM4 and 16CM5 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Christopher J. Hernandez appeared with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to 16CM5.   Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC, and on motion of DA, dismisses but reads in 16CM4 for purposes of collecting service fees, and states agreement not to charge Price County referral 16-816.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  DA gives court victim impact statement.  Court declines to accept the deferred agreement and sentences DE as follows.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

16CM5 - Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
$300 fine
$100 DOMAB
$200 DNAAS
$150 SBDA
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.  
Defendant may have non-abusive contact with Erica Hernandez for the purposes of discussing and arranging child related issues including, but not limited to, visitation, provided that such contact be in written form which may include physical mail, e-mail, instant messaging, and other electronic and non-electronic forms of communication generating a written or graphic record of the communication.  
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 29, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on March 29, 2017 at 09:00 am.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may have non-abusive contact with Erica Hernandez for the purpose of discussing and arranging child related issues including, but not limited to, visitation, provided that such contact be in written form which may include physical mail, e-mail, instant messaging, and other electronic and non-electronic forms of communication generating a written or graphic record of the communication.
for Modification of Bond
Jury trial on December 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

10:00 am- 16CM4 & 16CM5 - Defendant Christopher J. Hernandez appeared with attorney Daniel Francis Snyder.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements are not an issue in 16CM5. Parties stipulate to statements in 16CM4. So ordered. Parties comment regarding motion to modify bond.  Bond ordered modified immediately.  Attorney Snyder to prepare order to modify bond. Adj. 10:03 am.

Defendant may not have contact with Erica Hernandez, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept. with the exception of contacting for purposes of informing her of the no contact provision.

16CM4 & 16CM5 - Defendant Christopher J. Hernandez appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. One bond for both cases.
